page.title: 18SHOPS AND FACILITIES
page.content: There is a concentration of {shops} at G.R. 535905. Many of these shops are small family businesses and have been serving the local community for many years. Although there are two small self- service stores, most of the shops specialise in particular commodities and offer a personal service. Of the four {public houses} in the area the Trowel and Hammer at G.R. 539 907 is by far the oldest, originating from the the 17th cent. The Tramway Hotel at G.R. 537 905 is so named because it was at the terminus of the {tramway} which ran from Lowestoft to Pakefield until 1931. The local bus service has stops very close to the shops. For people living at the eastern end of Carlton Colville at G.R. 524 905 there are a few shops at this point. They do not offer as wide a variety of goods as the shops at Pakefield.
